Without comment - see code and `print()` results. from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3 12345 http://google.com
3.7.4 456789 http://foo.com
''' def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) rows = iter(table) trs = list(next(rows)) print('trs:', trs) ths = [th.text for th in iter(trs[0])] print('ths:', ths) for tr in trs[1:]: tds = [] for col in iter(tr): text = " ".join(col.itertext()).strip() tds.append(text) print('tds:', tds) out = dict(zip(ths, tds)) print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for x in res.items(): print(' - '.join(x)) else: print ('Version not found') Result trs: [, , ] ths: ['Release', 'REFDB', 'URL'] tds: ['3.7.3', '12345', 'http://google.com'] out: {'URL': 'http://google.com', 'REFDB': '12345', 'Release': '3.7.3'} URL - http://google.com REFDB - 12345 Release - 3.7.3

Without comment - see code and `print()` results. from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3 12345 http://google.com
3.7.4 456789 http://foo.com
''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) #rows = iter(table) #trs = list(next(rows)) trs = table.getchildren()[0].getchildren() print('trs:', trs) #ths = [th.text for th in iter(trs[0])] ths = [th.text for th in trs[0].getchildren()] print('ths:', ths) for tr in trs[1:]: tds = [] #for col in iter(tr): for col in tr.getchildren(): text = " ".join(col.itertext()).strip() tds.append(text) print('tds:', tds) out = dict(zip(ths, tds)) print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found') Result trs: [, , ] ths: ['Release', 'REFDB', 'URL'] tds: ['3.7.3', '12345', 'http://google.com'] out: {'URL': 'http://google.com', 'REFDB': '12345', 'Release': '3.7.3'} URL - http://google.com REFDB - 12345 Release - 3.7.3

Release REFDB URL
3.7.3 12345 http://google.com

''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) #rows = iter(table) #trs = list(next(rows)) trs = table.getchildren()[0].getchildren() print('trs:', trs) #ths = [th.text for th in iter(trs[0])] ths = [th.text for th in trs[0].getchildren()] print('ths:', ths) trs = table.getchildren()[1].getchildren() # <-- HERE print('trs:', trs) for tr in trs: # <-- HERE tds = [] #for col in iter(tr): for col in tr.getchildren(): text = " ".join(col.itertext()).strip() tds.append(text) print('tds:', tds) out = dict(zip(ths, tds)) print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found')

Without comment - see code and `print()` results. from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3 12345 http://google.com
3.7.4 456789 http://foo.com
''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) #rows = iter(table) #trs = list(next(rows)) trs = table.getchildren()[0].getchildren() print('trs:', trs) #ths = [th.text for th in iter(trs[0])] ths = [th.text for th in trs[0].getchildren()] print('ths:', ths) for tr in trs[1:]: tds = [] #for col in iter(tr): for col in tr.getchildren(): text = " ".join(col.itertext()).strip() tds.append(text) print('tds:', tds) out = dict(zip(ths, tds)) print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found') Result trs: [, , ] ths: ['Release', 'REFDB', 'URL'] tds: ['3.7.3', '12345', 'http://google.com'] out: {'URL': 'http://google.com', 'REFDB': '12345', 'Release': '3.7.3'} URL - http://google.com REFDB - 12345 Release - 3.7.3 --- **EDIT:** Version for new HTML from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3

12345

232323

4343454

5454554

http://google.com

http://test12213.com

3.7.4

456789

54545

5454545

545454

 http://foo.com
''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) #rows = iter(table) #trs = list(next(rows)) trs = table.getchildren()[0].getchildren() print('trs:', trs) #ths = [th.text for th in iter(trs[0])] ths = [th.text for th in trs[0].getchildren()] print('ths:', ths) trs = table.getchildren()[1].getchildren() print('trs:', trs) for tr in trs: tds = tr.getchildren() data = [] # first col data.append(tds[0].text) # second col temp = [x.text for x in tds[1].getchildren()] data.append(temp) # third col temp = [] for x in tds[2].getchildren(): if x.tag == 'a': temp.append(x.text) if x.tag == 'p': temp.append(x.getchildren()[0].text) data.append(temp) print('data:', data) # dictionary out = dict(zip(ths, data)) print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found') Result REFDB - ['12345', '232323', '4343454', '5454554'] Release - 3.7.3 URL - ['http://google.com', 'http://test12213.com']

Without comment - see code and `print()` results. from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3 12345 http://google.com
3.7.4 456789 http://foo.com
''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) #rows = iter(table) #trs = list(next(rows)) trs = table.getchildren()[0].getchildren() print('trs:', trs) #ths = [th.text for th in iter(trs[0])] ths = [th.text for th in trs[0].getchildren()] print('ths:', ths) for tr in trs[1:]: tds = [] #for col in iter(tr): for col in tr.getchildren(): text = " ".join(col.itertext()).strip() tds.append(text) print('tds:', tds) out = dict(zip(ths, tds)) print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found') Result trs: [, , ] ths: ['Release', 'REFDB', 'URL'] tds: ['3.7.3', '12345', 'http://google.com'] out: {'URL': 'http://google.com', 'REFDB': '12345', 'Release': '3.7.3'} URL - http://google.com REFDB - 12345 Release - 3.7.3 --- **EDIT:** Version for new HTML. I skiped `getchildren()` but it works the same way and it's shorter. from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3

12345

232323

4343454

5454554

http://google.com

http://test12213.com

3.7.4

456789

54545

5454545

545454

 http://foo.com
''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) # headers ths = [th.text for th in table[0][0]] #print('ths:', ths) # columns for tr in table[1]: data = [] # first col data.append(tr[0].text) # second col data.append([x.text for x in tr[1]]) # third col temp = [] for x in tr[2]: if x.tag == 'a': temp.append(x.text) else: temp.append(x[0].text) data.append(temp) #print('data:', data) # dictionary out = dict(zip(ths, data)) #print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found') Result Release - 3.7.3 REFDB - ['12345', '232323', '4343454', '5454554'] URL - ['http://google.com', 'http://test12213.com']

Without comment - see code and `print()` results. from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3 12345 http://google.com
3.7.4 456789 http://foo.com
''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) #rows = iter(table) #trs = list(next(rows)) trs = table.getchildren()[0].getchildren() print('trs:', trs) #ths = [th.text for th in iter(trs[0])] ths = [th.text for th in trs[0].getchildren()] print('ths:', ths) for tr in trs[1:]: tds = [] #for col in iter(tr): for col in tr.getchildren(): text = " ".join(col.itertext()).strip() tds.append(text) print('tds:', tds) out = dict(zip(ths, tds)) print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found') Result trs: [, , ] ths: ['Release', 'REFDB', 'URL'] tds: ['3.7.3', '12345', 'http://google.com'] out: {'URL': 'http://google.com', 'REFDB': '12345', 'Release': '3.7.3'} URL - http://google.com REFDB - 12345 Release - 3.7.3 --- **EDIT:** Version for new HTML. I skiped `getchildren()` but it works the same way using only indexes. And it's shorter. But it's more readable using `findall()` from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET s = '''
Release REFDB URL
3.7.3

12345

232323

4343454

5454554

http://google.com

http://test12213.com

3.7.4

456789

54545

5454545

545454

 http://foo.com
''' # --- functions --- def find_version(ver): table = ET.XML(s) # headers #ths = [th.text for th in table[0][0]] ths = [th.text for th in table.findall('.//th')] #print('ths:', ths) # rows #for tr in table[1]: for tr in table.findall('.//tbody/tr'): data = [] # first col data.append(tr[0].text) # second col data.append([x.text for x in tr[1]]) # third col temp = [] for x in tr[2]: if x.tag == 'a': temp.append(x.text) else: temp.append(x[0].text) data.append(temp) #print('data:', data) # dictionary out = dict(zip(ths, data)) #print('out:', out) if out['Release'] == ver: return out # --- main --- res = find_version('3.7.3') if res: for key, val in res.items(): print(key, '-', val) else: print ('Version not found') Result Release - 3.7.3 REFDB - ['12345', '232323', '4343454', '5454554'] URL - ['http://google.com', 'http://test12213.com']
